Therefore, the gods prosper and we decline.

original: tad enaṃ tvaṃ vārayitum arhasi tathā yathāsmān bhajed iti // //
analyzed: tat enam tvam vārayitum arhasi tathā yathā asmān bhajet iti
translated: Therefore, you should prevent him so that he will favor us.

analyzed: atha viśvarūpam nandana vanam upagatam mātā uvāca
translated: Then Viśvarūpa, who had gone to the Nandana garden, was told by his mother:

original: putra kiṃ parapakṣavardhanas tvaṃ mātulapakṣaṃ nāśayasi /
analyzed: putra kim para pakṣa vardhanaḥ tvam mātula pakṣam nāśayasi
translated: Son, why do you increase the power of others and destroy your maternal uncle's side?
You should not act like this.

original: sa viśvarūpo mātur vākyam anatikramaṇīyam iti matvā saṃpūjya hiraṇyakaśipum agāt // //
analyzed: sa viśvarūpaḥ mātuḥ vākyam an atikramaṇīyam iti matvā saṃpūjya hiraṇyakaśipum agāt
translated: Viśvarūpa, thinking that the words of his mother are not to be transgressed, having fully honored Hiraṇyakaśipu, went to him.

original: hairaṇyagarbhāc ca vasiṣṭhād dhiraṇyakaśipuḥ śāpaṃ prāptavān /
analyzed: hairaṇyagarbhāt ca vasiṣṭhāt hiraṇyakaśipuḥ śāpam prāptavān
translated: And Hiraṇyakaśipu received a curse from the golden-wombed Vasiṣṭha.

original: yasmāt tvayānyo vṛto hotā tasmād asamāptayajñas tvam apūrvāt sattvajātād vadhaṃ prāpsyasīti /
analyzed: yasmāt tvayā anyaḥ vṛtaḥ hotā tasmāt a samāpta yajñaḥ tvam apūrvāt sattva jātāt vadham prāpsyasi iti
translated: Since you have chosen another as the Hotṛ priest, therefore, your sacrifice will be incomplete, and you will meet your death from an unborn being.

original: tacchāpadānād dhiraṇyakaśipuḥ prāptavān vadham // //🔽viśvarūpo mātṛpakṣavardhano 'tyarthaṃ tapasy abhavat /
analyzed: tad śāpa dānāt hiraṇyakaśipuḥ prāptavān vadham  viśvarūpaḥ mātṛ pakṣa vardhanaḥ u tyartham tapasi abhavat
translated: And by the curse of that (sage), Hiraṇyakaśipu met with destruction.🔽Viśvarūpa, who increased the prosperity of his mother's side, became excessively devoted to austerities.

original: tasya vratabhaṅgārtham indro bahvīḥ śrīmatyo 'psaraso niyuyoja /
analyzed: tasya vrata bhaṅga artham indraḥ bahvīḥ śrīmatyaḥ psarasaḥ niyuyoja
translated: To break his vow, Indra employed many beautiful celestial nymphs.

original: tāś ca dṛṣṭvā manaḥ kṣubhitam tasyābhavat tāsu cāpsaraḥsu nacirād eva sakto 'bhavat /
analyzed: tāḥ ca dṛṣṭvā manaḥ kṣubhitam tasya abhavat tāsu ca apsaraḥsu nacirāt eva saktaḥ bhavat
translated: And seeing them, his mind became agitated, and he soon became attached to those celestial nymphs.

original: saktaṃ cainaṃ jñātvāpsarasa ūcur gacchāmahe vayaṃ yathāgatam iti // //
analyzed: saktam ca enam jñātvā apsarasaḥ ūcuḥ gacchāmahe vayam yathāgatam iti
translated: And knowing him to be attached, the celestial nymphs said, We shall go as we came.
To them, Tvaṣṭṛ's son said,

original: kva gamiṣyatha āsyatām tāvan mayā saha śreyo bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: kva gamiṣyathaḥ āsyatām tāvat mayā saha śreyaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Where will you go? Stay here for a while. It will be better for you to stay with me.
They said to him,

original: vayaṃ devastriyo 'psarasa indraṃ varadaṃ purā prabhaviṣṇuṃ vṛṇīmahae iti // //
analyzed: vayam deva striyaḥ psarasaḥ indram vara dam purā prabhaviṣṇum vṛṇīmahae iti
translated: We are celestial nymphs, the wives of the gods. We choose Indra, the giver of boons, the powerful one, as our lord.

original: atha tā viśvarūpo 'bravīd adyaiva sendrā devā na bhaviṣyantīti /
analyzed: atha tāḥ viśvarūpaḥ bravīt adya eva sa indrāḥ devāḥ na bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: Then Viśvarūpa said to them, Today itself the gods with Indra will cease to exist.
Then he muttered mantras.
By those mantras, he grew three heads.

original: ekenāsyena sarvalokeṣu dvijaiḥ kriyāvadbhir yajñeṣu suhutaṃ somaṃ papāv ekenāpa ekena sendrān devān /
analyzed: ekena āsyena sarva lokeṣu dvijaiḥ kriyāvadbhiḥ yajñeṣu su hutam somam papau ekena apaḥ ekena sa indrān devān
translated: With one mouth he drank the well-offered Soma in all the worlds in the sacrifices of the twice-born who perform rites, with one he drank the water, and with one he drank the Somas along with Indra and the gods.

original: athendras taṃ vivardhamānaṃ somapānāpyāyitasarvagātraṃ dṛṣṭvā cintām āpede // //
analyzed: athā indraḥ tam vivardhamānam soma pāna āpyāyita sarva gātram dṛṣṭvā cintām āpede
translated: Then Indra, seeing him thus growing, his whole body nourished by drinking Soma, became anxious.

original: devāś ca te sahendreṇa brahmāṇam abhijagmur ūcuś ca /
analyzed: devāḥ ca te saha indreṇa brahmāṇam abhijagmuḥ ūcuḥ ca
translated: And the gods, together with Indra, approached Brahma and said:

analyzed: viśvarūpeṇa sarva yajñeṣu su hutaḥ somaḥ pīyate
translated: The well-offered Soma is drunk in all sacrifices by Vishvarupa.

original: vayam abhāgāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ /🔽asurapakṣo vardhate vayaṃ kṣīyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam a bhāgāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ  asura pakṣaḥ vardhate vayam kṣīyāmaḥ
translated: We have become deprived of our share.🔽The Asura faction is growing, we are declining.

original: tad arhasi no vidhātuṃ śreyo yad anantaram iti // //🔽tān brahmovāca ṛṣir bhārgavas tapas tapyate dadhīcaḥ /
analyzed: tat arhasi naḥ vidhātum śreyaḥ yat anantaram iti  tān brahmā uvāca ṛṣiḥ bhārgavaḥ tapaḥ tapyate dadhīcaḥ
translated: You should ordain what is best for us hereafter.🔽To them Brahma said: The sage Dadhicha of the Bhargava lineage is performing austerities.

original: sa yācyatāṃ varaṃ yathā kalevaraṃ jahyāt /
analyzed: sa yācyatām varam yathā kalevaram jahyāt
translated: He should be requested to give up his body.
With his bones, let the thunderbolt be made.

original: devās tatrāgacchan yatra dadhīco bhagavān ṛṣis tapas tepe /
analyzed: devāḥ tatra agacchan yatra dadhīcaḥ bhagavān ṛṣiḥ tapaḥ tepe
translated: The gods went to the place where the blessed sage Dadhicha was performing austerities.

original: sendrā devās tam abhigamyocur bhagavaṃs tapasaḥ kuśalam avighnaṃ ceti /
analyzed: sa indrāḥ devāḥ tam abhigamya ūcuḥ bhagavan tapasaḥ kuśalam avighnam ca iti
translated: The gods with Indra approached him and said: Blessed one, are you well in your austerities and free from obstacles?

original: tān dadhīca uvāca svāgataṃ bhavadbhyaḥ kiṃ kriyatām /
analyzed: tān dadhīcaḥ uvāca svāgatam bhavadbhyaḥ kim kriyatām
translated: To them Dadhicha said, Welcome to you, what can I do for you?
Whatever you will tell me, I will do.

original: te tam abruvañ śarīraparityāgaṃ lokahitārthaṃ bhagavān kartum arhatīti /
analyzed: te tam abruvam śarīra parityāgam loka hita artham bhagavān kartum arhati iti
translated: They said to him, For the welfare of the world, the Blessed One should abandon his body.

original: X T / Kumbh / /ed / ins / / evam ukto dadhīcas tān abravīt /
translated: X Kumarila's ed. inserts: Having been thus addressed, Dadhicha said to them,

original: X sahasraṃ varṣāṇām aindraṃ padam avāpyate mayā yadi jahyām /
analyzed: sahasram varṣāṇām aindram padam avāpyate mayā yadi jahyām
translated: If I were to abandon my body, I would attain Indra's position for a thousand years.

original: X tathety uktvendraḥ svasthānaṃ dattvā tapasvy abhavat /
analyzed: tathā iti uktvā indraḥ sva sthānam dattvā tapasvī abhavat
translated: X Indra said, So be it, and gave him his own place, and became an ascetic.
X Indra became Dadhicha.

original: X tāvat pūrṇe sendrā devā āgaman kālo 'yaṃ dehanyāsāyeti / // X
analyzed: tāvat pūrṇe sa indrāḥ devāḥ āgaman kālaḥ yam deha nyāsāya iti
translated: X When that period was over, the gods with Indra came and said, This is the time for you to abandon your body.

original: atha dadhīcas tathaivāvimanāḥ sukhaduḥkhasamo mahāyogī ātmānaṃ samādhāya śarīraparityāgaṃ cakāra // //
analyzed: atha dadhīcaḥ tathā eva avimanāḥ sukha duḥkha samaḥ mahā yogī ātmānam samādhāya śarīra parityāgam cakāra
translated: X Then Dadhicha, the great yogi who was indifferent to pleasure and pain, entered into meditation and abandoned his body.

original: X Kumbh / /ed / ins / / śrutir apy atra bhavati /
translated: X The sacred texts also say this:

original: X indro dadhīco 'sthibhiḥ kṛtam iti / // X
translated: X Indra was made with the bones of Dadhicha.

original: tasya paramātmany avasṛte tāny asthīni dhātā saṃgṛhya vajram akarot /
analyzed: tasya paramātmani avasṛte tāni asthīni dhātā saṃgṛhya vajram akarot
translated: X When he had merged into the supreme self, the creator collected those bones and made them into a thunderbolt.

original: tena vajreṇābhedyenāpradhṛṣyeṇa brahmāsthisaṃbhūtena viṣṇupraviṣṭenendro viśvarūpaṃ jaghāna /
analyzed: tena vajreṇa abhedyena apradhṛṣyeṇa brahma asthi saṃbhūtena viṣṇu praviṣṭena indraḥ viśvarūpam jaghāna
translated: With that thunderbolt, which was indestructible, invincible, made of Brahma's bones, and entered by Vishnu, Indra killed the demon Vṛtra.
And he cut off his heads.

original: X T / Kumbh / /ed / Cv / / takṣṇā yajñapaśoḥ śiras te dadāmīty uktvā / // X
analyzed: takṣan yajña paśoḥ śiraḥ te dadāmi iti uktvā
translated: X T. Kumbh. Ed. Cvs. Having said, I will give you the head of the sacrificial animal, X

original: tasmād anantaraṃ viśvarūpagātramathanasaṃbhavaṃ tvaṣṭrotpāditam evāriṃ vṛtram indro jaghāna // //
analyzed: tasmāt anantaram viśvarūpa gātra mathana saṃbhavam tvaṣṭrā utpāditam eva arim vṛtram indraḥ jaghāna
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, Indra killed the enemy Vṛtra, who was born from the body of Vṛtra, who was born from Tvaṣṭṛ.

original: tasyāṃ dvaidhībhūtāyāṃ brahmavadhyāyāṃ bhayād indro devarājyaṃ parityajya apsusaṃbhavāṃ śītalāṃ mānasasarogatāṃ nalinīṃ apsu /
analyzed: tasyām dvaidhībhūtāyām brahma vadhyāyām bhayāt indraḥ deva rājyam parityajya apsusaṃbhavām śītalām mānasa saraḥ gatām nalinīm apsu
translated: When that sin of killing a Brahmin was divided in two, out of fear, Indra abandoned the kingdom of the gods and entered the cool waters born from the lake Mānasa, which had become a lotus in the water.

original: tatra caiśvaryayogād aṇumātro bhūtvā bisagranthiṃ praviveśa // //
analyzed: tatra ca aiśvarya yogāt aṇu mātraḥ bhūtvā bisa granthim praviveśa
translated: And by the power of his sovereignty, he became as small as an atom and entered the knot of a lotus stalk.

original: atha brahmavadhyābhayapranaṣṭe trailokyanāthe śacīpatau jagad anīśvaraṃ babhūva /
analyzed: atha brahma vadhyā bhaya pranaṣṭe trailokya nāthe śacīpatau jagat anīśvaram babhūva
translated: Then, when the lord of the three worlds, the husband of Śacī, disappeared out of fear of the sin of killing a Brahmin, the world became without a lord.
Passion and darkness entered the gods.

original: mantrā na prāvartanta maharṣīṇāṃ /🔽rakṣāṃsi prādur abhavan /
analyzed: mantrāḥ na prāvartanta mahā ṛṣīṇām  rakṣāṃsi prādur abhavan
translated: The mantras of the great sages did not function.🔽The demons appeared.
And the Vedas were destroyed.

analyzed: an indrāḥ ca abalāḥ lokāḥ su pradhṛṣyāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And the worlds became powerless and easily oppressed, without Indra.

original: atha devā ṛṣayaś cāyuṣaḥ putraṃ nahuṣaṃ nāma devarājatve 'bhiṣiṣicuḥ /
analyzed: atha devāḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca āyuṣaḥ putram nahuṣam nāma deva rāja tve bhiṣiṣicuḥ
translated: Then the gods and sages consecrated Nahuṣa, the son of Āyu, as the king of the gods.

original: nahuṣaḥ pañcabhiḥ śatair jyotiṣāṃ lalāṭe jvaladbhiḥ sarvatejoharais triviṣṭapaṃ pālayāṃ babhūva /
analyzed: nahuṣaḥ pañcabhiḥ śataiḥ jyotiṣām lalāṭe jvaladbhiḥ sarva tejaḥ haraiḥ triviṣṭapam pālayām babhūva
translated: Nahuṣa ruled heaven with five hundred blazing stars on his forehead, robbing everyone of their splendor.

original: atha lokāḥ prakṛtim āpedire svasthāś ca babhūvuḥ // //
analyzed: atha lokāḥ prakṛtim āpedire svasthāḥ ca babhūvuḥ
translated: Then the worlds returned to their natural state and became peaceful.
Then Nahuṣa said:

original: sarvaṃ māṃ śakropabhuktam upasthitam ṛte śacīm iti /
analyzed: sarvam mām śakra upabhuktam upasthitam ṛte śacīm iti
translated: Everything enjoyed by Indra is presented to me, except Śacī.

original: sa evam uktvā śacīsamīpam agamad uvāca cainām /
analyzed: saḥ evam uktvā śacī samīpam agamat uvāca ca enām
translated: Having said this, he went to Śacī and said to her:

original: subhage 'ham indro devānāṃ bhajasva mām iti /
analyzed: subhage ham indraḥ devānām bhajasva mām iti
translated: Beautiful one, I am Indra of the gods. Serve me.
Śacī replied to him:

analyzed: prakṛtyā tvam dharma vatsalaḥ soma vaṃśa udbhavaḥ ca
translated: By nature you are devoted to dharma and born in the lunar dynasty.

analyzed: na arhasi para patnī dharṣaṇam kartum iti
translated: You should not violate another's wife.
Then Nahuṣa said to her:
I am occupying Indra's position.

original: aham indrasya rājyaratnaharo nātrādharmaḥ kaścit tvam indrabhukteti /
analyzed: aham indrasya rājya ratna haraḥ na atra adharmaḥ kaścid tvam indra bhuktā iti
translated: I am the one who takes away Indra's kingdom and wealth. There is no sin in this, for you have been enjoyed by Indra.
She said to him:
I have a certain vow that is not yet completed.

original: tasyāvabhṛthe tvām upagamiṣyāmi kaiścid evāhobhir iti /
analyzed: tasya avabhṛthe tvām upagamiṣyāmi kaiścid eva ahobhiḥ iti
translated: I will come to you at its conclusion in a few days.'

analyzed: sa śacyā evam abhihitaḥ nahuṣaḥ jagāma
translated: Thus addressed by Shachi, Nahusha went away.

original: atha śacī duḥkhaśokārtā bhartṛdarśanalālasā nahuṣabhayagṛhītā bṛhaspatim upāgacchat /
analyzed: atha śacī duḥkha śoka ārtā bhartṛ darśana lālasā nahuṣa bhaya gṛhītā bṛhaspatim upāgacchat
translated: Then Shachi, afflicted with grief and sorrow, longing to see her husband, seized with fear of Nahusha, approached Brihaspati.

original: sa ca tām abhigatāṃ dṛṣṭvaiva dhyānaṃ praviśya bhartṛkāryatatparāṃ jñātvā bṛhaspatir uvāca /
analyzed: sa ca tām abhigatām dṛṣṭvā eva dhyānam praviśya bhartṛ kārya tatparām jñātvā bṛhaspatiḥ uvāca
translated: And Brihaspati, seeing her come, entered into meditation, and knowing her to be intent on her husband's welfare, said:

original: anenaiva vratena tapasā cānvitā devīṃ varadām upaśrutim āhvaya /
analyzed: anena eva vratena tapasā ca anvitā devīm vara dām upaśrutim āhvaya
translated: Endowed with this very vow and austerity, invoke the goddess Upa-Shruti, the bestower of boons.
She will show Indra to you.

original: sātha mahāniyamam āsthitā devīṃ varadām upaśrutiṃ mantrair āhvayat /
analyzed: sā atha mahāniyamam āsthitā devīm vara dām upaśrutim mantraiḥ āhvayat
translated: Then, observing a great vow, she invoked the goddess Upa-Shruti, the bestower of boons, with mantras.
Upa-Shruti came near Shachi.

original: uvāca cainām iyam asmi tvayopahūtopasthitā kiṃ te priyaṃ karavāṇīti /
analyzed: uvāca ca enām iyam asmi tvayā upahūtā upasthitā kim te priyam karavāṇi iti
translated: And she said to her, I am here, invoked by you and present. What pleasing thing shall I do for you?

original: tāṃ mūrdhnā praṇamyovāca śacī bhagavaty arhasi me bhartāraṃ darśayituṃ tvaṃ satyā matā ceti /
analyzed: tām mūrdhnā praṇamya uvāca śacī bhagavati arhasi me bhartāram darśayitum tvam satyā matā ca iti
translated: Shachi, bowing her head, said to her, O revered one, it is proper for you to show me my husband, for you are considered truthful.
She then took her to the Mansa lake.

analyzed: tatra indram bisa granthi gatam adarśayat
translated: There he showed Indra, who was in the lotus stalk.

original: tām indraḥ patnīṃ kṛśāṃ glānāṃ ca dṛṣṭvā cintayāṃ babhūva /
analyzed: tām indraḥ patnīm kṛśām glānām ca dṛṣṭvā babhūva
translated: Indra, seeing his wife thin and sick, thought:

original: aho mama mahad duḥkham idam adyopagatam /
analyzed: aho mama mahat duḥkham idam adya upagatam
translated: Alas, this great sorrow has befallen me today.

original: naṣṭaṃ hi mām iyam anviṣyopāgamad duḥkhārteti /
analyzed: naṣṭam hi mām iyam anviṣya upāgamat duḥkha ārtā iti
translated: For she has come to me, having searched for me, thinking I was lost.

analyzed: tām indraḥ uvāca katham vartayasi iti
translated: Indra said to her, How are you faring?
She said to him:
Nahusha summons me.

analyzed: kālaḥ ca asya mayā kṛtaḥ iti
translated: And I have set a time for him.
Indra said to her:
Go!🔽🔽

original: nahuṣas tvayā vācyo 'pūrveṇa mām ṛṣiyuktena yānena tvam adhirūḍha udvahasva /
analyzed: nahuṣaḥ tvayā vācyaḥ pūrveṇa mām ṛṣi yuktena yānena tvam adhirūḍhaḥ udvahasva
translated: Nahusha should be told by you: 'You should carry me in a vehicle yoked with sages, which is unprecedented for you.

original: indrasya hi mahānti vāhanāni manasaḥ priyāṇy adhirūḍhāni mayā /
analyzed: indrasya hi mahānti vāhanāni manasaḥ priyāṇi adhirūḍhāni mayā
translated: For Indra has great vehicles, dear to the mind, which I have ridden.
You should come to me in another one.'
Thus addressed, she went joyfully.

analyzed: indraḥ pi bisa granthim eva āviveśa bhūyas
translated: And Indra again entered the lotus stalk.

original: athendrāṇim abhyāgatāṃ dṛṣṭvovāca nahuṣaḥ pūrṇaḥ sa kāla iti /
analyzed: atha indrāṇim abhyāgatām dṛṣṭvā uvāca nahuṣaḥ pūrṇaḥ sa kālaḥ iti
translated: Then, seeing Indra's wife come, Nahusha said, The time is up.

analyzed: tam śacī abravīt śakreṇa yathā uktam
translated: Shachi said to him what Indra had told her.

original: sa maharṣiyuktaṃ vāhanam adhirūḍhaḥ śacīsamīpam upāgacchat // //
analyzed: sa mahā ṛṣi yuktam vāhanam adhirūḍhaḥ śacī samīpam upāgacchat
translated: He mounted a vehicle drawn by great sages and approached Śacī.

original: atha maitrāvaruṇiḥ kumbhayonir agastyo maharṣīn vikriyamāṇāṃs tān nahuṣeṇāpaśyat /
analyzed: atha maitrāvaruṇiḥ kumbhayoniḥ agastyaḥ mahā ṛṣīn vikriyamāṇān tān nahuṣeṇa apaśyat
translated: Then Agastya, the son of Mitra and Varuṇa, born from a pot, saw those great sages being afflicted by Nahuṣa.
And he was touched with his feet.

original: tataḥ sa nahuṣam abravīd akāryapravṛtta pāpa patasva mahīm /
analyzed: tatas sa nahuṣam abravīt akārya pravṛtta pāpa patasva mahīm
translated: Then he said to Nahuṣa, O sinner engaged in improper acts, fall to the earth.

original: sarpo bhava yāvad bhūmir girayaś ca tiṣṭheyus tāvad iti /
analyzed: sarpaḥ bhava yāvat bhūmiḥ girayaḥ ca tiṣṭheyuḥ tāvat iti
translated: Become a serpent as long as the earth and mountains stand.

original: sa maharṣivākyasamakālam eva tasmād yānād avāpatat // //
analyzed: sa mahā ṛṣi vākya sama kālam eva tasmāt yānāt avāpatat
translated: At the very moment of the words of the great sage, he fell down from that vehicle.

analyzed: atha an indram punar trailokyam abhavat
translated: Then the three worlds became without Indra again.

original: tato devā ṛṣayaś ca bhagavantaṃ viṣṇuṃ śaraṇam indrārthe 'bhijagmuḥ /
analyzed: tatas devāḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca bhagavantam viṣṇum śaraṇam indra arthe bhijagmuḥ
